Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Had a brunch and some conversations here. The place is nice and cozy, but a bit small. Better come with 2 people. We were 4 and they didn‚Äôt have a big table so they had to put two small tables together to make place for us, which is really ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text:
I have visited this place multiple times and I really enjoy their breakfast and brunch options. Orange juice served with breakfast is always fresh. They have lots of vegan options available.
They have both outdoor as well as indoor seating.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Amazing pastry offer. Overpriced for sure. One almond croissant 4.75. Service was super slow, a couple left while we were waiting but it's only die to one unmotivated staff member.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Espresso was terrible: burnt, acidic and 3.1 EUR. Chocolate croissant was not a croissant but Pain au Chocolat. "Le petit" menu (espresso + croissant + orange juice) for more than 10 EUR. Everything low quality and overpriced.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: The scrambled eggs and omelettes are delicious and the portions are big enough to keep you full all day.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: There are a handful of Le Pain Quotidien (LPQ) cafes around Amsterdam including this branch along Beethovenstraat. Opening hours 8am to 6pm daily. ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Waited 20 minutes to be served. Another 20 minutes for 2 coffees, a croissant and a muffin. There was no lack of staff. They just had no clue as to what to do.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Amazing place for brunch! Large portions, low prices, delicious combinations. Just the hot apple juice with cinnamon & ginger is worth a reward; toast is served with a white chocolate spread, among other deliciousness.. the day before we ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: The food is nice, the omelette is amazing...the service is really bad, the guys are too young (I don't think they get any training in customer service). So if you have patience and time, good place to eat.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Delicious quiche and salad! The portion was huge. I only ate half and took the other half for dinner.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Pretty good, pretty tasty, nice background music. Pretty good staff (try to help people in the order they are going to sit). Nice that you can use choco pasta (or jam) for free.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Very good and tasty food, fresh and good quality ingredients together with great service. Also, probably the best hot chocolate in town.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Amazing! See for yourself, all organic dishes, plentiful at a reasonable price. Service is great, best way to start a Sunday.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Beautiful breakfast, great coffee and friendly service. Highly recommend

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Was fairly crowded when I went on a Saturday morning. All organic breakfast. Quite pricey but decent food.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Well priced, consistent quality, delicious - preferred this to many other places we tried in Amsterdam

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Okay food,  nothing spectacular. Out of the three choices we made two weren't available. Friendly service. Okay location

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: The staff are courteous but they share responsibility for tables. This can lead to confusion. I ordered eggs with only baguette. The next waiter brought eggs with rye bread. I explained the order. He took the bread back and never came back. When I asked, he thought I didn't want any bread. 20 minutes lost.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: We ate breakfast here because it seemed like one of the few places open in the area. Food was decent and staff was friendly and helpful! Everything was decently priced for the portion sized. Overall, we had a good experience here, and would recommend it to people in the area!

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Love it! Lots of options, really decent portions for quite low prices compared to other brunch places. Everything is tasty and I love the bread (as a French I don't say that often here). ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Delicious range of whole foods and cakes. Great coffee served at large communal tables or  smaller two to four person tables. Service was a little slow and one of our meals was incorrect. The mistake was rectified quickly and without issue.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Maybe the worst lunch/service I ever had in Amsterdam in 2 years. The salad was without any dressing, literally taken from the bag and put on the plate. A thin slice of bread with half a loaf of bread on top (?), a scoop of goat cheese with ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Super bad service. I had to (1) get my menu myself after waiting for at least 7 min and (2) I asked to remove one chair to be less squeezed between the tables. The waiter refused despite me being uncomfortable and squeezed. It is not the ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Excellent food and service! Highly recommended

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Awful LPQ experience.. food was disgrace. As a big fan of LPQ in London my Amsterdam experience on Beethovenstraat was shameful. The food was just abhorable. The sitting crammed. But overall the food: my tartine was soggy, burnt on edges ‚Ä¶

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: We walked in and asked if they could serve 7 adults and 5 kids. There was a large table available. We were met with a frown and a big sigh as if to say it was really a pain to have customers!! Better watch out your customer welcome if you want to maintain your high rating.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: We ate breakfast and it was delicious.  I had goat cheese omelette and I added avocado.  The coffee and croissants were excellent

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Excellent food and coffee, very lovely service. Good alternative to the rotten Bbrood

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Liked the scrambled eggs served with bread and salad. they've got allergens marked and several vegan and non dairy options. Really good coffee with almond or soy milk. Eggs and coffee 10‚Ç¨

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Pretty nice place. Only had a nice wit beer but their food menu looked lekker. Friendly and nice location.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Was for the first time hier. It was not busy it all but everybody were busy with everything except the visitors.  Got my coffee only after 15 minutes that's all I have ordered. And the most disappointing the coffee was already cold.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Servers were very pleasant. Unique salad combinations. Had the lentil avocado salad with smoked salmon - tasty!

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Always a globally consistent franchise with decent food and coffee. Reasonably priced place with some small tables outside in good weather.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: it's a place where I could go more often as the food is very good and the meals are healthy but the staff could be more friendly with especially foreign customers!

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Organic pot-au-feu with quinua is very nice!  It's little bit noisy because of some customers today.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Visiting Amsterdam. We had early lunch at Le Pain Quotiden. Wondetful experience. Great food and service indeed

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Very busy during lunchtime. It was noisy and service was really slow. Food is good.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Nice place, delicious food, friendly service.

Name: Le Pain Quotidien
Review Text: Really good Pain. And that's a French word. So it say a lot. The best Brioche in town. Oeps, another one. Go and check it out.

Review Text: Lovely place for breakfast or brunch. This location has a great back garden. Wifi password: beethoven.

Review Text: Good quality but high prices. Pleasant atmosphere.
